Package ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api.service.mapping

Interface HttpAPI<T extends HttpAPI<T>>

Type Parameters:
T - is a type of interface that extends HttpAPI
public interface HttpAPI<T extends HttpAPI<T>>
This interface is designed to be a parent of interfaces that model behavior of some http API.

Child interfaces should declare methods that return RequestBuilder. These methods should describe application http API under the testing. Other methods should be static or they should have default modifier. default methods also may describe API of an applications in case when a method of an API has optional parameters (query parameters, elements of body, parts of a multipart bodies etc) or parameters with default values. This methods should overload general methods.

Used annotations to describe API:

  • Methods should be annotated by HttpMethod to define http method
  • Methods should be annotated by URIPath to define URI-path to requested endpoint
  • Methods may be annotated by Header to define required headers of resulted http request
  • Parameters of methods may be annotated by QueryParameter to define query parameters of resulted http request
  • Parameters of methods may be annotated by PathParameter to mark parameters of a method whose values define URI-path to requested endpoint. At this case URIPath.value() should have a substring like '{path_variable}' or 'begin/{path_variable}/path/to/end/point' that corresponds with declared PathParameter.name() '@PathParameter("path_variable")'
  • Parameters of methods may be annotated by Body. It marks a parameter those value is used as a body of resulted http request. This annotation should be used once per method. Combinations with URLEncodedParameter or with MultiPartBody are not allowed.
  • Parameters of methods may be annotated by URLEncodedParameter. It marks parameters those values are used as values in url-encoded form-body of resulted http request. Combinations with Body or with MultiPartBody are not allowed.
  • Parameters of methods may be annotated by MultiPartBody. It marks parameters those values are used as parts of a multipart body of resulted http request. Combinations with Body or with URLEncodedParameter are not allowed. Information given by the annotation may be supplemented by DefineFileName and/or DefineContentType

  • Method Details

    • createAPI

      static <T extends HttpAPI<T>> T createAPI​(Class<T> toCreate, URI uri)
      Creates an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI.
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of resulted instance
      Parameters:
      toCreate - is an interface to instantiate
      uri - is a root URI. It should consist of protocol/scheme, host/ip and port only
      Returns:
      is an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI

    • createAPI

      static <T extends HttpAPI<T>> T createAPI​(Class<T> toCreate, URL url)
      Creates an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI.
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of resulted instance
      Parameters:
      toCreate - is an interface to instantiate
      url - is a root URL. It should consist of protocol/scheme, host/ip and port only. Part of a path without ending '/' is possible to be included
      Returns:
      is an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI

      static <T extends HttpAPI<T>> T createAPI​(Class<T> toCreate, String uriStr)
      Creates an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI.
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of resulted instance
      Parameters:
      toCreate - is an interface to instantiate
      uriStr - is a string value of root URI. It should consist of protocol/scheme, host/ip and port only. Part of a path without ending '/' is possible to be included
      Returns:
      is an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI

    • createAPI

      static <T extends HttpAPI<T>> T createAPI​(Class<T> toCreate, ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.core.api.properties.url.URLValuePropertySupplier urlProperty)
      Creates an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI. It uses a value that is defined by some property as root URI. This value should consist of protocol/scheme, host/ip and port only. Part of a path without ending '/' is possible to be included
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of resulted instance
      Parameters:
      toCreate - is an interface to instantiate
      urlProperty - is an instance that reads a property and get an URL
      Returns:
      is an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI

    • createAPI

      static <T extends HttpAPI<T>> T createAPI​(Class<T> toCreate)
      Creates an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI. It uses a value defined by the property which is bound by Bind to the class. When there is no such property then it uses DefaultEndPointOfTargetAPIProperty.DEFAULT_END_POINT_OF_TARGET_API_PROPERTY as root URI.
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of resulted instance
      Parameters:
      toCreate - is an interface to instantiate
      Returns:
      is an instance of an interface that extends HttpAPI

      Adds instances that define parameters of resulted objects of RequestBuilder
      Parameters:
      requestTuners - instances that define parameters of resulted objects of RequestBuilder
      Returns:
      is supposed to return self-reference
